author: Bill Toulas
title: North Korean Kimsuky hackers exposed in alleged data breach
excerpt: The North Korean state-sponsored hackers known as Kimsuky has reportedly suffered a data breach after two hackers, who describe themselves as the opposite of Kimsuky's values, stole the group's data and leaked it publicly online. [...]

author: Bill Toulas
title: Netherlands: Citrix Netscaler flaw CVE-2025-6543 exploited to breach orgs
excerpt: The Netherlands' National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) is warning that a critical Citrix NetScaler vulnerability tracked as CVE-2025-6543 was exploited to breach "critical organizations" in the country. [...]

author: Bill Toulas
title: Details emerge on WinRAR zero-day attacks that infected PCs with malware
excerpt: Researchers have released a report detailing how a recent WinRAR path traversal vulnerability tracked as CVE-2025-8088 was exploited in zero-day attacks by the Russian 'RomCom' hacking group to drop different malware payloads. [...]

author: Sergiu Gatlan
title: Microsoft tests cloud-based Windows 365 disaster recovery PCs
excerpt: Microsoft has announced the limited public preview of Windows 365 Reserve, a service that provides temporary desktop access to pre-configured cloud PCs for employees whose computers have become unavailable due to cyberattacks, hardware issues, or software problems. [...]

author: Mayank Parmar
title: OpenAI is testing 3,000-per-week limit for GPT-5 Thinking
excerpt: OpenAI has responded to criticism that it shipped GPT-5 with token limits to minimize cost and maximize profit not with words, but rather with a new 3,000-per-week limit. [...]

author: Mayank Parmar
title: OneNote finally gets "paste text only" feature on Windows and Mac
excerpt: Microsoft confirmed that it's testing the ability to paste text only (plain format) to OneNote for Windows and Mac. [...]

author: Mayank Parmar
title: xAI is testing Grok 4.20 to take on GPT-5, may launch this month
excerpt: Elon Musk-owned xAI is testing Grok 4.20, a small update to Grok 4, which already competes with GPT-5 in some benchmarks, such as ARC-AGI 2. [...]

author: Sponsored by Varonis
title: The Rise of Native Phishing: Microsoft 365 Apps Abused in Attacks
excerpt: Native phishing turns trusted tools into attack delivery systems. Varonis shows how attackers weaponize Microsoft 365 apps, like OneNote & OneDrive, to send convincing internal lures and how to spot them before they spread. [...]

author: Bill Toulas
title: MuddyWater’s DarkBit ransomware cracked for free data recovery
excerpt: Cybersecurity firm Profero cracked the encryption of the DarkBit ransomware gang's encryptors, allowing them to recover a victim's files for free without paying a ransom. [...]

author: Sergiu Gatlan
title: 'Chairmen' of $100 million scam operation extradited to US
excerpt: The U.S. Department of Justice charged four Ghanaian nationals for their roles in a massive fraud ring linked to the theft of over $100 million in romance scams and business email compromise attacks. [...]

author: Sergiu Gatlan
title: Over 29,000 Exchange servers unpatched against high-severity flaw
excerpt: Over 29,000 Exchange servers exposed online remain unpatched against a high-severity vulnerability that can let attackers move laterally in Microsoft cloud environments, potentially leading to complete domain compromise. [...]

author: Sergiu Gatlan
title: Connex Credit Union data breach impacts 172,000 members
excerpt: Connex, one of Connecticut's largest credit unions, warned tens of thousands of members that unknown attackers had stolen their personal and financial information after breaching its systems in early June. [...]

author: Mayank Parmar
title: How to restore GPT-4o when you've GPT-5
excerpt: Sam Altman overhyped GPT-5 and the results are underwhelming. Some users are upset with GPT-5's new personality, but you can restore GPT-4o if you pay for the Plus plan. [...]

author: Bill Toulas
title: Google Calendar invites let researchers hijack Gemini to leak user data
excerpt: Google fixed a bug that allowed maliciously crafted Google Calendar invites to remotely take over Gemini agents running on the target's device and leak sensitive user data. [...]
